content.title: Weeknotes: From Legacy To Luxury — Week 24

content.html:
• What to say. Stats are looking good this week. Packed quite a lot in. Tapped into some positive energy. Wrote 0 Golang. Wrote lots of words.
  • This week in data:
    • Papers Read: 1
    • Palace Run: -9 seconds
    • Chess ranking: +3 ELO
  • 今ちょっと暑いね？　うちのエアコンは頑張ってるよ！
  • Lots of recruitment activities this week, including I think the greater number of interviews done in a week in a hot minute. (the 2019 record is probably impossible to beat though).
  • The JS community said it couldn’t be done, but in a tiny technical win, I figured out how to feature-flag something gnarly this week. (Maybe still technical?).
  • Marking roughly a year since it started, Papers Club finished our longest paper yet, completing our deep-dive into Mixture of Experts architecture. In our year we’ve welcomed guests, new members and new structure and I’ve learned lots.
  • Move over 微妙 & 成る程, my new favourite word is 確かに and it’s ENDLESSLY applicable.
  • Have resumed running outside of the gym, and so attempted Palace Run again. Last time I ran it was in 2018, but despite coming back after several years, this attempt saw a better finishing time with both better pace & recovery. Lots of room for improvement but this is my first “long run” in years and I’m still here! Quite happy.
  • Two glasses of wine let me say some silly things, whilst regrettably, not saying some other things. But in a good way this time. In vino veritas, eh.
  • and in LB’s old yard of all places.
  • Completed more steps of The Internet Saga. They sent me a letter! Conclusion hopefully soon!
  • Since it’s all available on YouTube, I’ve been watching the Horne Section show over breakfast all week. It’s been quite nice to enjoy a slice of British TV comedy (since, unfortunately most of it is paywalled outside of the UK!).
  • OH: “What’s the opposite of a bar-raiser?”
  • Rediscovered my notes from that stand-up course last summer. Reader, the temptation is real. Somebody stop me.
